communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: Police Records Request, Reference # P000732-040625 Dear Thomas Jackson, The City of Las Cruces received the following public records request from you on April 07, 2025: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Daijah Cano on May 13, 2023, at approximately 12:31 AM, at or near 1200 Milton, Doña Ana County, NM, by the Las Cruces Police Department (LCPD). 

Specifically, I am seeking: 

The arrest report, including officer narratives, probable cause statements, and any citations or charges filed 

Any body-worn camera (BWC) footage recorded by arresting or responding officers 

The 911 call audio and transcript, if one was made in connection with this incident 

Any booking photos (mugshots) and related documentation 

Any dispatch records or CAD logs for this incident 

This request is made in the interest of transparency and public accountability in routine law enforcement actions. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Thomas Jackson 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Flas-cruces-new-mexico-police-department-4431%252Fdaijah-cano-arrest-may-13-2023-184476%252F%253Femail%253Dkperalta%252540las-cruces.org&url_auth_token=AAAWk2FNE129jWDSFr7SU9dcyI4%3A1u1cCG%3A5PuP2nkpn6mu6Jnm5KeSvQ_UI6bHOLlxbrqmb5RYI5Y 
The purpose of this message is to provide you with a partial response to the Inspection of Public Records Act (hereinafter “IPRA”) request you provided the City of Las Cruces (hereinafter “City” or “Las Cruces”). The City has gathered, reviewed, and appropriately redacted the following public records associated with your request: 
One (1) document and four (4) videos 
 
  *  New Mexico Statutes Annotated (hereinafter “NMSA”) Section 14-2-1.1 states “Protected personal identifier information contained in public records may be redacted by a public body before inspection or copying of a record.” The term “protected personal identifier information” is defined within NMSA Section 14-2-6(F) to include:  (1) all but the last four digits of a: (a) taxpayer identification number;  (b) financial account number; (c) credit or debit card number; or (d) driver’s license number;  (2) all but the year of a person’s date of birth; (3) a social security number; and (4) with regard to a nonelected employee of a public body in the context of the person’s employment, the employee’s nonbusiness home street address, but not the city, state or zip code;  therefore, any of the above-described “protected personal identifier information” found within the responsive records have been redacted. 
  *  New Mexico Statutes Annotated (hereinafter “NMSA”) 1978, § 14-2-1.2(A)(8) states, in pertinent part, that “Law enforcement records are public records, except “records pertaining to physical or mental examination and medical treatment of persons unless the information could be relevant to a criminal investigation or an investigation of misfeasance, malfeasance or other suspected violation of law conducted by a person elected to or employed by a public body,” and therefore, such records “may be redacted from a written record or digitally obscured in a visual or audio record.” Therefore, any medical records and/or the discussion of medical diagnosis found within the responsive records have been redacted. New Mexico Statutes Annotated (hereinafter “NMSA”) 1978, § 14-2-1(J) states that every person has a right to inspect public records of this state except “information concerning information technology systems, the publication of which would reveal specific vulnerabilities that compromise or allow unlawful access to such systems; provided that this subsection shall not be used to restrict requests for (1) records stored or transmitted using information technology systems and (2) internal and external audits of information technology systems, except for those portions that would reveal ongoing vulnerabilities that compromise or allow unlawful access to such systems.” Therefore, any records that would disclose methods for unlawfully accessing technology systems contained within the responsive records have been redacted. A download link with the contents of this request has been e-mailed to you from AXON.  This download link expires in three (3) days. Please contact our office by replying to this email or via telephone if you have any issues accessing the documents or if you wish to receive the documents in another format. Pursuant to NMSA 1978, § 14-2-10, the City has determined that your written request is excessively burdensome and/or broad. More specifically, the City has determined that it requires an additional reasonable period of time to gather, review, and appropriately redact any and all public records associated with your request.  Although the City cannot anticipate when the remainder of the responsive records associated with your request will become available, the City will produce them within a reasonable period of time. Further, the City will provide a written status update regarding your request within fifteen (15) days. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. Should you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact my office. Sincerely, 
Christine Rivera 
Records Custodian 
(575) 541-2112 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Records Request Portal (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXWd-2Fso983yWRO0GFwBuhD01hu9R0EtkDMoRyiO-2BtdBT63R7XK-2FD93Xzrv-2BR6mrt2aR7no9jGx2ug399WudbsFHE-3Dv08-_YkYJwdAw-2BXC7xefVjcKFjJGGHLnu7Zfr-2Br-2FlyL2JP4Mzh6NRL-2BBN5XD-2F-2FaQb3XNQT5vZO8XM-2Fv3mi-2Bzmd29pJ4JjABSlGB1qqT6Uk9P4hMk4YGxkOYlplv85p9iz250FFDypkjhP2QkwsCAfnfqVh0S3RZI3V38UdizPkRIAbsZvsjXOy-2Bsevg-2Fi48GGZEDGO-2BfeFQxois-2FPkGnhC2NpCuv-2FnUAQBpefOTBU-2B3tdMVBpqF9DPeVx8SmYQGoqeSsjWDBGv-2FE4eoQBse9-2Fl02cUHqYobkvcRk1GcpY3SqY3q-2BG2pk6nt1kAxzD8hWfbhrTqZCJIDkUSm3tc038OOcLPArD1b8tzzLcU82UWLJSBE6s1z-2FgRzXwGX2TuOjAhvAv)

communications.subject: RE: Government Records Request Human Services/Division of Family Development C232352
communications.communication:
Good Morning,

The Department of Human Services (DHS), Division of Family Development (DFD) received your Open Public Records Act (OPRA) request C232352 on March 28, 2025.  As such, the seven (7) business day deadline to respond to your request is April 8, 2025.  This response to your request is being provided to you on April 8, 2025.

Your OPRA request seeks access to: "Contract awarded to Rutgers Southern Regional CCR&R for the administration of the New Jersey Child Care Assistance Program (CCAP) by the NJ Department of Human Services, Division of Family Development."

Please be advised that the attached records are the records that DFD has in its custody, and are being provided in their entirety and are responsive to your request.

If your request for access to a government record has been denied or unfilled within the seven (7) business days required by law, you have a right to challenge the decision by DFD to deny access. At your option, you may either institute a proceeding in the Superior Court of New Jersey or file a complaint with the Government Records Council (GRC) by completing the Denial of Access Complaint Form.  You may contact the GRC by toll-free telephone at 866-850-0511, by mail at P.O. Box 819, Trenton, NJ, 08625, by e-mail at Government.Records@dca.nj.gov, or at their web site at www.nj.gov/grc. The Council can also answer other questions about the law.  All questions regarding complaints filed in Superior Court should be directed to the Court Clerk in your County.

********************************************************************************************

State Agency: Human Services/Division of Family Development

Requestor Name: Toni Thompson
Company: Muck Rock News
Address:              MuckRock News
DEPT MR 184006
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115
Email: 184006-51002989@requests.muckrock.com<mailto:184006-51002989@requests.muckrock.com>
Telephone: N/A

Convicted of indictable offense: NO

Used for a commercial purpose: NO

Being sought in connection with a legal proceeding: NO

Preferred Delivery: E-Mail
Maximum Authorized Cost: $1
Payment Method: Check
Requested Information: Contract awarded to Rutgers Southern Regional CCR&R for the administration of the New Jersey Child Care Assistance Program (CCAP) by the NJ Department of Human Services, Division of Family Development.

********************************************************************************************

Please do not hesitate to contact me with any questions or comments.

Regards,
Christian V. Chang, Esq.
Department of Human Services, Division of Family Development Office of Policy and Legal Affairs
6 Quakerbridge Plaza
P.O. Box 716
Trenton, NJ 08625
(609)588-2282



This E-mail, including any attachments, may be intended solely for the personal and confidential use of the sender and recipient(s) named above. This message may include advisory, consultative and/or deliberative material and, as such, would be privileged and confidential and not a public document. Any Information in this e-mail identifying a client of the Department of Human Services is confidential. If you have received this e-mail in error, you must not review, transmit, convert to hard copy, copy, use or disseminate this e-mail or any attachments to it and you must delete this message. You are requested to notify the sender by return e-mail.

    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    All documents on, about, mentioning, or concerning the private investigator
    Richard Lee Bast (October 18, 1932 - March 21, 2001), Social Security No.
    578-40-9899 and the companies he founded in the greater Washington, DC area
    known as Redex Corporation (1970s) and International Investigations, Inc.
    (1980-90s).
    
    I understand that the file may be rather large. If it exceeds 5,000 pages, I
    wish to speak to a negotiator to help reduce the scope of responsive
    records.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Emma Best

communications.subject: FOIA request 1411473(Redex Corp)
communications.communication:
Good morning Ms. Best,

We're contacting you about the FOIA request you made for records concerning Redex Corp. The FBI has located approximately 2948 pages that are potentially responsive to your request. Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system, and the FBI receives a voluminous amount of requests on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium (51-950 pages), large (951-8000 pages), and extra-large (over 8000 pages) sub-tracks based upon request size. 

Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  The more potentially responsive pages a request has, the more complex it becomes, greatly increasing the time required for processing.  Generally, the larger the file, the longer it takes to process. A review of your request determined that it is currently in the complex request large processing track.  Given our current workload and staffing levels, it may yet be a long time before you begin to receive material from this request.   

Reducing the scope of your request may accelerate the processing and allow for a more timely receipt of the information you seek, as it could potentially place your request into a smaller, faster processing track.  This may also reduce duplication costs, if applicable.  Would you be willing to consider reducing the scope of your request?  If so, I would be happy to help you to decide the best approach to take.  We could potentially narrow your request by date, or if you are looking for something specific, we could approach the scope reduction process in that way.

Please let us know if you would like to potentially reduce the scope of your request.  We can be reached via email at fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov, or you may call 540-868-1695, Monday - Friday between the hours of 7:00am and 3:00pm Eastern time.

Best regards,

FOIA Negotiation Team
FBI Information Management Division
540-868-1695

Need a status check? Contact FOIPA Questions (foipaquestions@fbi.gov).

communications.subject: FOIPA # 1411474
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon Ms. Best,

We're contacting you about the FOIA request you made for records concerning Richard Bast.  The FBI located approximately 3,144 pages that are potentially responsive to your request.  Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system, and the FBI receives a voluminous amount of requests on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium (51-950 pages), large (951-8000 pages), and extra-large (over 8000 pages) sub-tracks based upon request size. 

Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  The more potentially responsive pages a request has, the more complex it becomes, greatly increasing the time required for processing.  Generally, the larger the file, the longer it takes to process.  A review of your request determined that it is currently in the complex request large processing track.  Given our current workload and staffing levels, it may yet be a long time before you begin to receive material from this request.   

Reducing the scope of your request may accelerate the processing and allow for a more timely receipt of the information you seek, as it could potentially place your request into a smaller, faster processing track.  This may also reduce duplication costs, if applicable.  Would you be willing to consider reducing the scope of your request?  If so, we would be happy to help you to decide the best approach to take.  If you are looking for something specific, we could approach the scope reduction process in that way.

The current average time to complete a large track request is approximately 56 months. 

Please let us know if you would like to potentially reduce the scope of your request.  If you reduce the size, you can request the additional records with a new FOIA request upon completion of this one. 

We can be reached via email at fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov, or you may call 540-868-4894.  We appreciate your patience and hope to hear from you soon.


Sincerely,



Negotiation Team
FOIA Support Unit
FBI Information Management Division
Fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov
540-868-4894

title: SF Office of the Mayor calendar requests

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: SF Office of the Mayor calendar requests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The calendars for the following officials in the San Francisco Office of the Mayor for the period covering January 8, 2025 - March 19, 2025:

Mayor Daniel Lurie
Alicia John-Baptiste, chief of infrastructure, climate, and mobility 
Kunal Modi, chief of health, homelessness, and family services 
Ned Segal, chief of housing and economic development

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kristi Coale, independent journalist

Dear Kristi:

Thank you for contacting the Office of the Mayor. We have received your request today in the mail and will respond within 10 days.  

Please note that we are only able to provide records in the possession or control of the Office of the Mayor. Other City agencies may hold additional responsive records and you would need to contact them directly. 

Kind regards,

Office of the Mayor of San Francisco
Sunshine Requests
These documents are responsive to your request. We now consider your request closed.

title: University of California Santa Cruz PRA Databases

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: University of California Santa Cruz PRA Databases
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1 — any databases and/or spreadsheets used to track requests under the California Public Records Act from September 1, 2023 to the date of this request.
2 — any and all policy documents, manuals, memos and/or reports regarding the processing of public records requests from September 1, 2023 to the date of this request.

In the regard to the database requested in paragraph 1, please provide the database in its original electronic format pursuant to Cal. Gov. Code § 6253.9.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ed Burton

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Immigration Enforcement
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All communications between the Lyon County Sheriff’s office and U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement from January 1, 2025 to March 10, 2025. 
- All communications between the Lyon County Sheriff’s office and Tom Homan from January 1, 2025 to March 10, 2025. 
- Any records regarding the Delegation of Immigration Authority Section 287(g) Immigration and Nationality Act 
- A copy of the agreement for Lyon Douglas County Sheriff's office to join ICE’s Section 287 (g) program
-all policies related to interacting with non us citizens

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dave Maass

communications.subject: Lyon County Public Records Request dated March 18, 2025
communications.communication:
Hello Dave,

I am responding to the Public Records Request dated March 18, 2025.

The fee for a copy of the policy regarding interactions with immigrants is
$10.00. If you are interested in receiving the report, submit payment with
a credit card by going to the AllPaid web site https://allpaid.com/
Please enter the code 4179 in the Payment Destination and specify in the
notes that it is for a Public Records Request and the date of your request.
When you receive the payment receipt, please forward a copy to
SORecords@lyon-county.org and we will process your request.

As for communications with either U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement
or Tom Homan from January 2, 2025 to March 10, 2025, we have had no
communications.

We have no records regarding the Delegation of Immigration Authority
Section 287(g) Immigration and Nationality Act, nor is there an agreement
to join ICE's Section 287(g) program.

During the requested time period, we received four (4) ICS detainers,
however those are federal documents containing personal information and
would require a release by the Department of Homeland Security. Please
contact them for this information.

If you have any questions please let me know.

THank you.

-- 
*Respectfully,*

*Colleen R. Straub*
Records Manager
Lyon County Sheriff's Office
911 Harvey Way, #1
Yerington, NV  89447
775-463-6600, ext. 3060
cstraub@lyon-county.org
“Do unto others as you would have them do unto you” -- The Golden Rule

*Optimism.* Pessimists don’t change the world. Optimists do.

communications.subject: RE: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Immigration Enforcement
communications.communication: Thank you for the response. Could you break down what the fee is for?

communications.subject: Re: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Immigration Enforcement
communications.communication:
You requested a copy of "all policies related to interacting with non us
citizens." The fee is for a copy of the policy.

communications.subject: RE: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Immigration Enforcement
communications.communication:
Thank you for the follow-up. 

As you know, the Nevada Public Records Act states that "a fee must not exceed the actual cost to the governmental entity to provide the copy of the public record."  NPRA also states that, " A governmental entity shall prepare and maintain a list of the fees that it charges" and this includes disclosing "fee that the governmental entity charges to provide a copy of a public record."  In addition, if the record exists electronically, then NPRA also states I may receive an electronic copy of the record. 

I hope you can appreciate that it is difficult for me to understand how it would cost $10 to email me a PDF of an agreement. However, in the unlikely case that your agency only maintains records in paper format and therefore a paper copy is appropriate, one would expect a reasonable charge of $0.05 per page (as is standard among state agencies).  If we account for $3 for postage, and double the fee to $.10 a page, that would indicate your policy is 70 pages long, which seems extraordinary.

Accordingly, please provide an accounting of what the fee is for so I may assess whether this fee does not exceed the cost to you.

Thank you, 

Dave Maass

communications.subject: Re: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Immigration Enforcement
communications.communication:
Hello,

The fee for a copy of the three-page policy regarding interactions with
immigrants is
.75 cents. If you are interested in receiving the report, submit payment
with
a credit card by going to the AllPaid web site https://allpaid.com/

Please enter the code* 4179* in the Payment Destination and specify in the
notes that it is for a *Public Records Request and the date of your request*
.
When you receive the payment receipt, please forward a copy to
SORecords@lyon-county.org and we will process your request.

Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Immigration Enforcement
communications.communication:
Thank you. I will follow-up with payment of $0.75.

I would just note that the system you have sent me to does require a fee, which may not be an acceptable charge under NPRA.

communications.subject: Re: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Immigration Enforcement
communications.communication:
Thank you for the note. The fee is a processing fee that AllPaid charges to
process a credit card payment.

If you would rather, you can mail a check to us and we will provide the
policy when the check clears. Would you prefer that?

communications.subject: Re: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Immigration Enforcement
communications.communication:
Are you interested in continuing with this request or shall I close it?

Please let me know at your earliest convenience.

Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Immigration Enforcement
communications.communication:
Yes, I am committed to continuing this request. I am in the process of getting spending authorization for the $.75 and processing fee.  

We will need a formal invoice with statement of services from you. How soon can you or your finance department issue that? This is standard practice among government agencies charging for records. 

To be honest, it may be a better use of taxpayer resources to waive the fee and share the records, rather than go through this paperwork for less than a dollar. However, I understand that we both have bureaucratic processes to follow and it may be out of your hands to make such a judgment call. 

Dave Maass

communications.subject: Re: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Immigration Enforcement
communications.communication:
When you make the payment, you will receive a receipt. It is this receipt
that you will need to send to SORecords@lyon-county.org to show proof of
payment to receive the policy. The receipt will show the payee, purpose for
the payment and a breakdown of the payment. That is also why you are asked
to enter "Public Records Request" in the notes. In effect, you are
providing the information that you require when you submit the payment.

communications.subject: RE: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Immigration Enforcement
communications.communication: The fee has been paid.

communications.subject: Re: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Immigration Enforcement
communications.communication:
Hello,

I have received your proof of payment for the policy related to interacting
with non-US citizens.

Attached, please find the policy requested.

I will consider this request closed.

Thank you.

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Melissa Paz-Diaz Arrest – March 30, 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Melissa Marie Paz-Diaz on March 30, 2025, at approximately 3:24 AM, by the Dade City Police Department in Dade City, Florida.

According to public records, Paz-Diaz was arrested for:

Domestic Battery – Florida Statute 784.03(1A1), with a bond set at $1,000

I am specifically requesting:

The full arrest and incident reports, including officer narratives and any witness or victim statements

Any available body-worn camera (BWC) footage from responding officers

911 call recordings and transcripts related to the incident

Any photos, video evidence, or dispatch/CAD logs

Any documentation relating to injuries, use of force, or scene investigation

Given the nature of the charge, this request is submitted in the interest of transparency and public oversight of law enforcement response to domestic violence cases.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

John Smith

communications.subject: Dade City, FL -Records Request Confirmation PD-2025-108
communications.communication:
“Request Number: PD-2025-108 - Monday, April 7, 2025” Your Request is being processed in accordance with Chapter 119 of the Florida State Statutes. 
  
 Request Number PD-2025-108 and Security Key F754725B 
  
 Your Request will be forwarded to the relevant City department(s) to locate the information you seek. Chapter 119.07(4), Florida Statutes, provides for fees to process Public Records Requests that require extensive research and/or resources. You will be contacted about the availability and/or any fees required. If no extensive search fees are assessed, you will be contacted when your request is complete. Dade City has 10 days to respond to your request. If more time is required, you will be contacted by email. 
  
 Thank you, 
  
 
,

communications.subject: Dade City, FL. Records Request PD-2025-108 Completed
communications.communication:
Hello, 
  
 The request Request Number: PD-2025-108 has been completed. Attached is the report, photos, and BWC. For any audio, 911 recordings, or CAD print outs you will need to contact the Pasco County Sheriffs Office.  
  
 Request Number: PD-2025-108 
  
 Security Key: F754725B 
  
 If you have any questions, please contact the Dade City City Clerk's office at (352) 523-5052. 
  
 Thank you, 
  
   
 
,

[Records Center] Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Luis Guzman, 
 
Thank you for registering with Oxnard CA Public Records Center. 
 
Your Login ID is:  107975-93488243@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXbg4vZAz-2BcF6YnMBrX4PZh0e-2Bfiily5wAsCKzG5VEdzSNRV5tbs8rPwJpvJulhm-2BMhMTb-2FkRvGqezu3tM-2FsFRZ8-3DmFOp_Xfxs1J0C4VfSnIx1-2FDfyJMF58PFQn8-2BcJmnvnJQWkPWeiV-2BcsCn3m1jkWe2LJt-2F93eX2nx3zya7sfT415ebqIlDpB-2BzcixNyJoIRi-2FTVBiiZc1fdFrjCm1wKCrkXFnWH9Cqj0gHT-2FOx58xAKIYrFcwVhTR8y01-2Bfpv5UNdPYhBxvk6KlqodXuFXPAVRZZhKM44-2FDSqC5-2B90fOG9wE-2FvJwYfym1XPKLGVTV-2BW8JhuIlE-3D) 
 
Please login to "My Request Center" to update your account information, track the status of your request and receive requested records when they become available. This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: POLICE RECORDS REQUEST :: P000284-032625
communications.communication:
Dear Luis Guzman: 
Your request was received in this office on 3/26/2025 and given the reference number P000284-032625 for tracking purposes. 
 Records Requested: 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
"To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following California Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Feb. 10, 2021. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response. This communication was originally to greg.hebert@oxnardpd.org. Please see the following request.
---
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Part A: Information related to Automated License Plate Reader (ALPR) data sharing.

1) The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ALPR data;
2) The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data;
3) The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hot list” information;
4) The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hot list” information;

Part B: Information Related to Numbers of “Detections” (plate scans) and “Hits” (plate scans that matched to a hotlist)

5) The aggregate number of detections collected during 2018;
6) The aggregate number of “hits” during 2018;
7) The aggregate number of detections collected during 2019;
8) The aggregate number of “hits” during 2019.
9) The aggregate number of detections collected during 2020;
10) The aggregate number of “hits” during 2020.

To date, more than 60 California law enforcement agencies have provided us this data, including: American Canyon Police Department, Auburn Police Department, Bakersfield Police Department, Bell Gardens Police Department, Bell Police Department, Beverly Hills Police Department, Brentwood Police Department, Buena Park Police Department, Carlsbad Police Department, Cathedral City Police Department, Citrus Heights Police Department, Claremont Police Department, Contra Costa County Sheriff's Office, CSU Fullerton Police Department, Cypress Police Department, Emeryville Police Department, Folsom Police Department, Fullerton Police Department, Galt Police Department, Garden Grove Police Department, Gardena Police Department, Hemet Police Department, Hermosa Beach Police Department, Irvine Police Department, La Habra Police Department, La Mesa Police Department, La Verne Police Department, Laguna Beach Police Department, Livermore Police Department, Lodi Police Department, Martinez Police Department, Merced Police Department, Mill Valley Police Department, Modesto Police Department, Newport Beach Police Department, Orange County Sheriff's Office, Orange Police Department, Palm Springs Police Department, Pasadena Police Department, Pleasant Hill Police Department, Pomona Police Department, Redlands Police Department, Redondo Beach Police Department, Sacramento Police Department, San Bernardino County Sheriff's Office, San Diego County Sheriff's Office, San Diego Police Department, San Mateo County Sheriff's Office, Sausalito Police Department, Seal Beach Police Department, Simi Valley Police Department, Stockton Police Department, Tiburon Police Department, Torrance Police Department, Tracy Police Department, Tustin Police Department, Woodland Police Department, and the Yolo County Sheriff's Office.

For items 1-4: This information is easily available within the Agency’s Vigilant Solutions LEARN system. The simplest way to extract this data is to generate an “Agency Data Sharing Report” PDF file from within LEARN. To do this, a user may simply go to the “Sharing” section of LEARN and select “Output Report.” A CSV/XLS file containing these records would also satisfy this request. The instructions for extracting this data is described on pages 62-63 of the LEARN Agency Manager Guide, which may be found at this link: https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/3860685-LEARN-5-1-Agency-Manager-Guide.html

For items 5-10: This information is easily available within the Agency’s Vigilant Solutions LEARN system. The simplest way to extract this data is to generate a “Dashboard Hit Ratio Report” PDF file from within LEARN. We would prefer the data for each year to be provided separately. The instructions for extracting this data is described on pages 78-79 of the LEARN Agency Manager Guide, which may be found at this link: https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/3860685-LEARN-5-1-Agency-Manager-Guide.html

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Luis Guzman

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Foxnard-police-department-347%252Fcalifornia-automated-license-plate-readers-alpr-oxnard-police-department-107975%252F%253Femail%253Dgreg.hebert%252540oxnardpd.org&url_auth_token=AAAcq_0ApGwk7ZwdW4nClNnFn5s%3A1txczz%3AVq64lsA3z0PLrLSc7Fdmu9IHvT67RnKEu6K5XG4jCFk" 
 
 You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the City of Oxnard's Public Records Center. Please note, if your request for records was submitted on a weekend, holiday, or after business hours, it will be considered received on the next business day. 
City of Oxnard

communications.subject: [Records Center] POLICE RECORDS REQUEST :: P000284-032625

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST Reference # P000284-032625. Dear Luis Guzman, The City of Oxnard has reviewed its files and has located responsive records to your request. The records are attached to this message.  You may also access and retrieve these documents at by downloading them from the Public Records Center. This fulfills your Public Records Act request # P000284-032625 and concludes the response from the City of Oxnard. Sincerely, Melissa Garibay 
City of Oxnard

Oxnard, CA 93030

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: ORT charges (Orange County District Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

From 1/1/2019-3/11/2025, for any case where any one of the following penal code
sections were charged: 490.4 (a), 459.5, 484(a) – (and whether the special
allegation of 490.2 was alleged), the following statistical information:
- Date of filing
- Additional charges
- Age of the defendant at the time of the crime
- Race/national origin/ethnicity
- Gender
- Outcome proceeding type + date
- Outcome (dismissal, sentence, etc)
- Amount of theft if entered in PIMS

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: Initial Report in re: Secretary Hegseth Memo on "Restoring America's Fighting Force"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Initial Report in re: Secretary Hegseth Memo on "Restoring America's Fighting Force"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This request concerns the January 29, 2025 "MEMORANDUM FOR SENIOR PENTAGON LEADERSHIP COMMANDERS OF THE COMBATANT COMMANDS DEFENSE AGENCY AND DOD FIELD ACTIVITY DIRECTORS," entitled "Restoring America's Fighting Force," issued by the Secretary of Defense. A copy of the memo is available at https://media.defense.gov/2025/Jan/29/2003634987/-1/-1/1/RESTORING-AMERICAS-FIGHTING-FORCE.PDF.

I request a copy of the "initial report" by the Task Force to the Under Secretary of Defense for Personnel and Readiness. The initial report was due on or before March 1, 2025.

REQUEST FOR EXPEDITED PROCESSING:

I request that this request be expedited under 32 CFR § 286.8(e)(1)(i)(B) for the following reasons:

1. I certify the following to be true and correct: My organization is primarily engaged in disseminating information. The Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE) maintains a news website at https://thefire.org/news, through which its staff members regularly publish news stories and editorial content concerning the activities of governments, government officials, and other persons or organizations of public concern. I am a staff member of FIRE. I frequently write about matters involving the First Amendment and press freedom, including on FIRE's website. See, e.g., https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303. A substantial component of my duties as a staff member of FIRE is to obtain information through public records requests, including through the Freedom of Information Act, which I or my colleagues then share through FIRE's website and social media channels. I also publish news and other information of public concern via "X" (https://x.com/adamsteinbaugh) and "Bluesky" (https://bsky.app/profile/adamsteinbaugh.bsky.social).

2. The requested information concerns an actual or alleged government activity, namely the Secretary's creation of a task force and the initial report by the task force.

3. The requested information extends beyond the public's right to know about government activity generally and instead has a particular value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis. The information pertains to a news story of public interest. That issue has attracted a wide range of news media coverage, including the numerous articles identified below. The information has value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis because it concerns the the Secretary's implementation of a presidential policy priority, and because the public's feedback on the "initial report" may impact the Task Force's final report, which is due on June 1, 2025. If that information is only disclosed months or years later, it will inhibit the ability of the public to understand how its current officials are making decisions.

Examples of recent articles demonstrating the public's ongoing and current interest in this information include articles:

a. https://www.foxnews.com/politics/trump-dod-creates-task-force-abolish-dei-offices-promote-systemic-racism
b. https://www.dailywire.com/news/pentagon-guts-dei-programs-from-u-s-military
c. https://thehill.com/policy/defense/5114409-pence-hegseth-military-promotions-race-sex/
d. https://subscriber.politicopro.com/article/2025/01/hegseth-sets-up-pentagon-task-force-to-roll-back-diversity-programs-00201320
e. https://www.stripes.com/theaters/us/2025-01-30/hegseth-dei-defense-department-promotions-academies-16654199.html
f. https://www.defenseone.com/policy/2025/01/hegseth-stands-anti-dei-task-force/402623/
g https://www.campusreform.org/article/hegseth-orders-end-affirmative-action-admissions-service-academies/27419

Additionally, the Department itself published an article concerning the Task Force, reflecting its recognition that there is a public interest in timely information about it: https://www.defense.gov/news/news-stories/article/article/4047592/defense-secretary-directs-creation-of-task-force-to-restore-americas-fighting-f/


REQUEST FOR A FEE WAIVER OR REDUCED FEES:

I request, under 32 CFR § 286.12(l), a waiver or reduction of fees for the following reasons:

1. Disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because its disclosure would shed light on the operations or activities of the government. The requested information pertains specifically to the policies, procedures, and practices of senior Department officials concerning the Department's policies and programs.

2. Disclosure of the requested information would be likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of those operations or activities. Disclosure of the requested information would meaningfully inform the public about the Department's activities and operations, as the information pertains to the policies and underlying information driving decisions by senior Department officials. Disclosing the policies and other information would demonstrate the bases for those decisions, which have attracted substantial public attention, as demonstrated by the articles cited above. That information is not in the public domain.

3. Disclosure of the requested information will contribute to the understanding of a reasonably broad audience of persons interested in the subject, as opposed to the individual understanding of the requester. The requestor is a licensed attorney who practices First Amendment law. As such, the requestor will be able to effectively convey information to the public. Further, the requestor is a representative of the news media. The requestor and his employer, the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, gather information of potential interest to a segment of the public, turns that information into distinct works (including through its news website, located at https://thefire.org/news), and distributes that information to the public. The information requested here relates to information that is about current events or that would be of current interest to the public. The requestor's past publication record (in addition to FIRE's articles available at https://thefire.org/news) is available at https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303.

4. The requested information is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. The requestor works for a nonprofit organization and the records are not sought for a commercial purpose.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: [External Message Added] City and County of San Francisco public records request #25-1549
communications.communication:
City and County of San Francisco ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #25-1549: We are confirming that we received your Public Records Request today and we assigned it as PRR#25-1549.    Our department will identify and compile the requested information. The Sunshine Ordinance requires departments to respond as soon as possible or within ten calendar days from receipt of any records requests. Therefore, we will contact you as soon as the responsive documents are ready and will do so on or before March 10, 2025, as permitted by San Francisco Administrative Code § 67.21(b) and California Government Code § 6253(c). Sincerely, San Francisco Municipal Transportation Agency 1 South Van Ness Avenue, 7th floor San Francisco, CA 94103 ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City and County of San Francisco.
Technical support: See our help page

communications.subject: [External Message Added] City and County of San Francisco public records request #25-1549
communications.communication:
City and County of San Francisco ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #25-1549: Please be advised we are hereby invoking an extension of an additional 14 calendar days from March 10, 2025, to respond to your request. Under the California Public Records Act and the San Francisco Sunshine Ordinance, the deadline can be extended for an additional fourteen days due to "the need to search for and collect the requested records from field facilities or other establishments that are separate from the office processing the request," "the need to search for, collect, and appropriately examine a voluminous amount of separate and distinct records that are demanded in a single request," and "the need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another agency having substantial interest in the determination of the request or among two or more components of the agency having substantial subject matter interest therein." Cal. Gov't Code §7922.535(b), formerly §6253(c)(1), (2), and (3). The SFMTA is invoking the extension on these grounds because staff must (1) collect and examine a voluminous amount of material, and (2) consult with another City agency having substantial subject matter interest in the request. We will endeavor to respond to your request as soon as possible, but not later than March 24. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City and County of San Francisco.
Technical support: See our help page

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (Jefferson Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

Evergreen Consultants



Dear Alisia,

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law (FOIL), Dutchess Community College approves your request for the attached records. The enclosed Excel documents provide requested information derived from an employee database maintained by the Office of Human Resources.

The Faculty Census Information you have requested is provided in the Excel documents entitled Faculty Census for Evergreen and Faculty Highest Degree with Names Redacted.

The Staff Census Information you have requested is provided in the other enclosed Excel documents.

FOIL concerns access to agency records and does not require a public entity to provide information in response to questions.  Nonetheless, Dutchess Community College provides the following responses to your questions related to the compensation study your company is conducting.

Sincerely,
Dr. Irene Okwang
AVP Human Resources/Record Access Officer

title: Number and impact of data center customers (Snohomish County Public Utility District No. 1)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Number and impact of data center customers (Snohomish County Public Utility District No. 1)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Number of Data Center Customers - The total number of customers categorized as "data centers" or equivalent from January 1, 2019, to the present, broken down by year.
2. Electricity Consumption - The total electricity consumption (in kilowatt-hours or megawatt-hours) attributed to data center customers for each year from January 1, 2019, to the present.
3. Growth of Data Center Customers - Year-over-year growth (in terms of number and consumption) of data center customers from January 1, 2019, to the present.
4. Internal Communications - All internal communications, including emails, meeting minutes, memos, and reports, related to policies, plans, or discussions on serving data center customers, dated from January 1, 2019, to the present.
5. Policies and Guidelines - Any official or draft policies, guidelines, or procedures created, revised, or implemented since January 1, 2019, that address the operation, service rates, or requirements for data center customers.

To assist in processing this request, I am specifically interested in documents, communications, or data related to:
- Power usage and billing structures for data center customers.
- Discussions on accommodating the growth of data centers in the service area.
- Environmental and infrastructure impact considerations related to data center customers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robin Monks

To process items 4 and 5 of your request we conducted a search of all of the accounts of 17 employees reasonably likely to have records responsive to your request.  We used the following search terms: "northpoint", "northpointe", "large load", "system impact study", "large single load", "wildan", "willdan", "data center", and "NLSL".

Conservatively, we are charging a 10% deposit for the hits on "data center" pursuant to RCW 42.56.120. The charges allowed include, but are not limited to, .10 cents per page for scanning, .05 for each 4 electronic files and .10 per gigabyte.  For "data center" alone that total is $210.10y.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #S000034-012825
communications.communication:
Thank you for following up and letting me know this query is likely overly broad.
In an effort to reduce the scope I am amending my previous request to focus specifically on:

Communications, contracts, and documents related to the selection of Willdan Group, Inc. as the implementer of SnoPUD's energy efficiency program for telecommunications and data center facilities, from the initial RFP/bidding process through final selection.

    1. Financial records showing:
        a. The approved budget for this three-year program
        a. All invoices, payments, and billing records related to Willdan's services
        a. Any cost-benefit analyses conducted regarding this program

    2. Program planning documents that outline:
        a. The scope and objectives of the telecommunications and data center energy efficiency program
        b. Performance metrics or energy conservation targets established for the program
        c. Any reports from Willdan to SnoPUD regarding program implementation or results

Please limit the search to records dating from January 1, 2022 to present. For email search terms, please use a combined query to limit results equivalent to: 
'Willdan' AND ('telecommunications' OR 'data center' OR 'energy efficiency program' OR 'contract' OR 'selection' OR 'RFP' OR 'proposal')

It's my hope this narrowed scope should significantly reduce the number of responsive records while focusing on the most relevant information about this specific data center and telecommunications program and contractor relationship.

Thank you,
Robin

2. Electricity Consumption - The total electricity consumption (in kilowatt-hours or megawatt-hours) attributed to data center customers for each year from January 1, 2019, to the present. 
3. Growth of Data Center Customers - Year-over-year growth (in terms of number and consumption) of data center customers from January 1, 2019, to the present. 
4. Internal Communications - All internal communications, including emails, meeting minutes, memos, and reports, related to policies, plans, or discussions on serving data center customers, dated from January 1, 2019, to the present. 
5. Policies and Guidelines - Any official or draft policies, guidelines, or procedures created, revised, or implemented since January 1, 2019, that address the operation, service rates, or requirements for data center customers. 

To assist in processing this request, I am specifically interested in documents, communications, or data related to: 
- Power usage and billing structures for data center customers. 
- Discussions on accommodating the growth of data centers in the service area. 
- Environmental and infrastructure impact considerations related to data center customers. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Robin Monks 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fsnohomish-county-public-utility-district-no-1-40422%252Fnumber-and-impact-of-data-center-customers-snohomish-county-public-utility-district-no-1-180273%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAImeqjaTx130zw051kOX0T0Q4Q%3A1tcxr5%3Azl4ub5J0UKPWZdcPPSW3bcOrP6kt-Yjx7QLHEeRVQwY” 
You have clarified this request to be seeking: 
"1. Communications, contracts, and documents related to the selection of Willdan Group, Inc. as the implementer of SnoPUD's energy efficiency program for telecommunications and data center facilities, from the initial RFP/bidding process through final selection. 

2. Financial records showing: 

a. The approved budget for this three-year program 
b. All invoices, payments, and billing records related to Willdan's services 
c. Any cost-benefit analyses conducted regarding this program 

3. Program planning documents that outline: 
a. The scope and objectives of the telecommunications and data center energy efficiency program 
b. Performance metrics or energy conservation targets established for the program 
c. Any reports from Willdan to SnoPUD regarding program implementation or results 

4. For email search terms, please use a combined query to limit results equivalent to: 'Willdan' AND ('telecommunications' OR 'data center' OR 'energy efficiency program' OR 'contract' OR 'selection' OR 'RFP' OR 'proposal'). 

Please limit the search to records dating from January 1, 2022 to present." 
After reviewing all of the emails, there are 282 unique emails responsive to your request.  They have been prepared and are ready for release upon receipt of payment.  The charges are: 
Electronic Files - 282 Electronic Files. $.05/4 files: $3.50 
Please send a check or money order in the amount of $3.50 payable to the Snohomish County PUD #1 and send to: 
Snohomish County PUD #1 
Attn: Sara Di Vittorio 
PO Box 1107 
Everett, WA 98206-1107 
If payment is not received by April 21, 2025, this request will be considered abandoned and closed. 
Sincerely, 
Sara Di Vittorio 
Senior Counsel & Public Records Officer 
General Counsel 
425-783-8682

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Ricardo Carreon Open Record Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am submitting this letter in order to request all documents, public information and public records related to Case ID 24001957, described below.  Please be advised that this request is hereby submitted pursuant to The Texas Open Records Act, Texas Government Code Chapter 552, and The Federal Freedom of Information Act.  I would like to request that all such public information and records be produced as soon as possible.  Please be advised that your agency will be paid the requisite fees, in accordance with the Open Records Act, with respect to your compliance with this request for the production of public records and documents.

Our office represents Ricardo Carreon in regard to injuries he sustained in an accident  on November 22, 2024 at approximately 06:41 AM.  The location of the accident was 2000 57th Street in Temple TX.  The public information and documents which I am requesting at this time (including information that is collected, assembled, or maintained under a law or ordinance or in connection with the transaction of official business by or for a government body, which included the media on which the public information is recorded, paper, film, magnetic, optical, and/or solid state device that can store an electronic signal; tape; computer disk; etc.) are as follows:

•	Any video or photographs taken at the scene of the collision, in the officer’s cruiser, or by responding officers bodycam,

•	Any witness statements, handwritten notes, or supplemental accident report information, 
 

•	An audio copy of the 911 calls from witnesses who called in to report this accident, along with any witness names, addresses, and phone numbers that may be in possession of the communications center, along with any police reports that correspond to this particular incident. 

•	Copies of all sketches, diagrams, witness statements and/or names and phone numbers of witnesses at the scene who did not give statements that may be in the possession of your department.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Vic Feazell

communications.communication:
City of Temple TX ************************************************************************ Your record request #25-162 has been submitted successfully. Your request will be processed accordingly. You will need to log in and activate your account to view this request. If there are any exceptions to disclosure which pertain to the release of any of the documents or records you have requested, the Texas Public Information Act (PIA) requires that the City submit arguments to the Texas Attorney General within 10 business days from receiving your request, and the Attorney General has 45 business days to issue a ruling regarding the applicable exceptions to disclosure. Information that is determined to be not subject to an exception under the PIA, or documents which are deemed releasable after receiving the Attorney General’s ruling, will be released to you promptly.
